uni.joel.deckard.logic

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • uni.joel.deckard.logic.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends Object
    A player in a battle has a hand composed of a few cards. These are the cards they can next use in battle.
    Author:
    Joel

      Adds the given card to the hand.

      Returns the amount of the given card in the hand.
      HashMap<Card,Integer> getCards() 
      void removeAmountOfCard(Card card, int removeAmount)
      Removes the specified amount of the given card from the hand, or as much as possible if the amount to be removed is larger than the amount of card in the hand.

      Removes one of the given card from the hand.

    • Method Detail

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card card)
        Adds the given card to the hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The given card.

      • removeAmountOfCard

        public void removeAmountOfCard(Card card,
                               int removeAmount)
        Removes the specified amount of the given card from the hand, or as much as possible if the amount to be removed is larger than the amount of card in the hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The card to be removed.
        removeAmount - The amount to be removed.

      • removeCard

        public void removeCard(Card card)
        Removes one of the given card from the hand. Does nothing if no amount of given card is in the hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The card, one of which should be removed.

      • amountOfCard

        public int amountOfCard(Card card)
        Returns the amount of the given card in the hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The card of which amount is being asked.
        Returns:
        The amount of the card in the hand.

        public HashMap<Card,Integer> getCards()

        public void setCards(HashMap<Card,Integer> cards)
